intro: Cirrhaea dependens, commonly known as the hanging cirrhaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often hang from rocks or soil surfaces. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and have a delicate, feathery appearance. Cirrhaea dependens is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as woodland floors or along stream banks.
